--The first spool was great material. The second, not so much. I guess it was bound to happen sooner or later, and I've bought well over 30 spools. This spool I got just isn't printing quite right. I know I could easily return it, because Makergeeks is cool like that.
Before returning you should check some things first.
--First is temp. Too cool and you'll get warping upward, or even clogging. Too hot and you'll get stringy printing and warping downward. Room temp can also be a factor in manipulating your printing temp. I've noticed that different colors, even different spools may vary a little in temp. Different machines can also vary in temp. I guess it's according to the thermistor set up on the machine.
--Second is moisture. This can affect quality in prints even cause problems with extruding.
--At one point I was having problems with materials printing solid. The layers would print right on part of it then brake up on other parts. There was also this clicking sound I couldn't trace down. I eventually found out that the gears in my extruder motor wearing out.
--It pays to check a few things out first. Just saying. I'm not ready to give on this spool yet. I've got to do some more test on it first. I learned the hard way, but hopefully this helps someone else.

name: Mike
title: Easy Assembly
review: Makergeek was quick to respond to questions.  Printer is solid/sturdy.  The feeder tube on occasion interferes with the autolevel feature, which is a sensor at the top of the hotend (allowing the print head to be used similar to the probe).

name: Bandanam4n
title: Awesome Performance For an Awesome price
review:
I use this thing 24/7
i had to tinker to get it running
no "dedicated" software
awesome prints
awesome quality
sturdy
enclosed

name: Shutterspeed
title: Returned my eBay printer and bought this
review: I purchased a less expensive Wanhao 3D printer on line and struggled with it for over a month.  The seller was extremely gracious and gave me a full refund.  I unpacked the Creator Pro and was printing two color projects very quickly after leveling the bed.  I am really enjoying this printer!

name: Ballard Bandit
title: Beautiful Blue, Glows Green
review:
How you use the product: Toys, keyrings.

Things that are great about it: Great Color, Low Odour, High Strength, Consistent Diameter, Solid spool reel.

Things that aren't so great about it: The website picture showed it glowed blue.

name: MrBaz
title: Glittery Brown
review: Got this as part of a sampler pack. Prints more of a shimmery brown than a true metallic. It still looks great in bright direct light. Like a dull copper color.

name: P
title: beautiful finish - looks amazing
review: Great filament, again absolutely amazing when acetone treated, looks nearly like real bronze.

name: Angie the MOM
title: Love the sample pack
review: We used the filaments for small projects to decide which filaments work best in our printer and for our uses.

name: Sid
title: Fun to try out
review: We used this to experiment making tires for robotics. Although we didn't actually use it on the robot, it was fun to experiment with.

name: bandanam4n
title: Glow in the Dark is great!
review: I use this for random things that are on display.

name: djeclipse25
title: Great filament
review:
I have about 30 hours or more into the makergeeks filaments without any issues. The parts I am printing are generally with a 0.6mm nozzle @ 0.2mm layers, and take 9hrs or more a piece.
Finally not throwing my money into he garbage.

name: David
title: Good Stuff
review: This is good filament, especially for the price.  I like the color. The best compliment for filament is that it works without issue and this does that.

name: Fredjikrang
title: Amazing!
review:
I got some of this in the exotics pack, and it printed amazingly well on my Solidoodle Press! I didn't have any trouble with it at all at a temperature of 230ºC, with the bed set to 50º C.

This printed much, much better than T-glass! If only it wasn't so expensive!

name: rdrink
title: Dissolvable!
review: This filament worked great the first time I tried it. Extruded fine, then dissolved quickly and easily (in limoneen).

name: Triphi
title: Nice for printing bones.......
review:
Good for general purpose printing.
Great for printing bones as it is closer to a bone white.
Tend to get brown spots if temperature is set too high.
I use it to print scans of people.
Have bought more and will buy more.
Use on Printrbot Metal, two Solidoodles, and three Flashforge Creators.

name: adamwest
title: models turn out great in white
review: Perfect for prints that should be looked at as being your prints and not for people worrying about that color or that shade. IT IS WHITE letting people see your print for what it is.

name: IntrepidDismay
title: Bendlay Extruder Mod
review:
I use it on my makerbot 1.
Heated to 234 degrees, heat bed at 45 degrees / 100% fill with a glass bed, blue painters tape and a small amount of mod podge for great adhesion. Nice flat prints and easy to pop off the heat bed, but the print job is hard to separate from the raft. but with patience and an exacto knife, it will come apart.

name: Rachnid
title: Definately Worth it!
review:
I outsourced one of these from china a while back.
with that said, I have now replaced it with this one. the differences? I did not have to wait a month and half, and this one is much better made.
no burrs, smooth printing, and cool looking to boot.
definately the best J-head I have come accrossed

name: Bob
title: The only way to get this ROBO3D to print
review:
Great Product!! The only way to get this junk ROBO3D to print anything. A++ great product. Awesome machining! Love the printed fan mount!!

Only wish you identified what wire does what? Fix the description - Fiber insulated thermistor... fiberglass wire not attached to thermistor.... I figured it out.

name: JArslan
title: Hard core quality
review: Amazing quality, great design. When you put this guy on your printer it changes the dynamic to where you are looking at a solid piece of machinery. I was doubting my new found love of 3d printing before I had this guy in place, Now I have far less (or at all) messed up prints.

name: Arzlanman
title: Hard core quality
review: Added this to my Mini Kossel, this was the third replacement to my Peek versions that kept dying on me, it has stayed up and running for much longer the the cheaper ones I had so worth the month. Also it was nice that it looked quite cool.

name: Travis S
title: Fantastic Hotend
review:
I bought this as a replacement/upgrade for my hacked up Printrbot Simple.

It required some simple wiring and some adjustments on my printer to fit. I was very impressed by the quality of the wiring, and the fit an finish of the product. I had to modify my printer a bit to work around the largish (compared to the Ubis hot end) heat sink.

I have been printing a good amount of PLA at 200 C, and I find the results to be much better then the Ubis hot end that I was using.

name: Jordan the leperchuan
title: The God of Hot Ends
review: I bought this product awhile ago and it is amazing; it prints like a dream. I have only had one problem with it which was my fault while printing I was determining temp and with this hotend can get really....well Hot!! lol; the filament got stuck in the hotend but it was so easy to remove from this one. I was back printing in no time

name: Matt
title: Why would anybody not buy this
review: I like the design of this extruder. And I love how it looks on my printer. And if I ever wanted to use a different size filament I could just use the extra nozzle that comes with it.

name: XxSaveryxX
title: Beautiful! Glows great!!
review: I purchased this product for a project in my digital fabrication class. When it came in, I was excited to check out how bright the color was right away and put it under a black light. To my surprise, the filament glowed green, not purple. Although it didn't glow the color I wanted, I still used it in my project and got an A. Everyone in the classroom loved how it looked under a black light and even a few people asked to use it for their project. I highly recommend it, just remember that it glows green...not purple.

name: MrBaz
title: Really white
review: I had absolutely no problems printing this filament. It took me a while of priming some of this filament in order to get all of the black color out of the hot end. After that, this filament was super white. Very shiny after treating it with some acetone.

name: Hamhog55
title: outstanding stuff
review: We ran this white color and never had a problem with it not extruding.

name: Super Stonegiant
title: Good bearings for small projects.
review:
-These are great for small projects.
-Solid, smooth rolling bearings.
-They are the same ones on the Makergeeks spool holder. I doubled mine up since some of the spools vary in width. Even with adding 4 extra bearings, the Makergeeks spool holder is still a great price. The spool holder will also save stress on your extruder motor.

name: KD
title: Good stuff for strong parts
review:
Prints up nicely. Had to use raft for best adhesion.

Very strong compared to ABS and PLA. Printed at 245C for hot end and 70C for bed temp.

name: TheJubbez
title: Amazing Filament and Cheap!!!
review: the first print i did was an note 2 case it printed amazing solid and i would trust my phone with it. after that made some miniatures and earnings for my lady, they will hold up for ever!!! no separation of layers like pla.

name: MrMaint (Mr. Maintenance)
title: Bought for stronger prints
review: I am new to 3D printing. I have only owned my Printrbot Simple for about a month. I wanted to get stronger printed parts than what I was getting with PLA, but did not acheive that. I tried many different settings over a week of printing with this product. What worked the best for me was to set the temp +10 degrees higher, and to set my print speed to half of the speed that I was using to get good PLA prints with. Even at that, I was still having problems with layer delamination. I was printing on an aluminum print bed with blue (Harbor Freight) masking tape layer (rubbed down really well).

name: Eternal Armory
title: A work horse!!!!
review:
I cannot say how much I love this printer. I have another more expensive SLA printer, and right now we have shifted the bulk of our prints to this one. Reason, it cost less to operate and runs without a flaw so far. We still use the SLA printer for highly detailed lettering which we leave areas to glue those on.

We are mainly custom Cosplay prop builders so we use this machine to make a master that we then mold up and resin cast parts from.

name: harlandmii
title: Nice Printer
review: Super quiet. Nice construction. Had some problems with temperature fluctuation when I first received it, but with a little trouble shooting, got everything going. Wanhao tech support not very helpful.

name: Wizechatmgr
title: Loving it
review:
Wing-nuts drop off bed leveling mechanism during shipping - search for them and you'll find them somewhere in the box or device.

LCD sometimes goes wacky in middle of long prints - not a big deal since you get music when it completes... Usually resets shortly after - odds are LCD cable needs to be shielded. I just watch Simplify 3d's stats to make sure all is going well.

Major plus - metal frame - provides for less need to re-level bed.

Works with Windows 8.1 & 7.

name: Travis
title: Excellent starter pack!
review: Bought this pack shortly after building my Printrbot Simple and I was not let down.  While the printer kit came with some sample filament, it was very difficult to use and get consistent prints.  This pack though was much easier to dial in a good heat and other settings, and I getting very good results with little setting adjustments.

name: KMX
title: Wonderful
review: At first I was kind of disappointed about the amount, but I soon got over it and was very impressed at the quality of the filament and the vibrant colors.

name: KMX
title: Great Quality
review: At first I was kind of disappointed about the amount of filament included for the price. But I soon got over it and once I used it, I was amazed at the quality and the vibrant color.

name: Natasha R.
title: Love it!
review: I bought a PLA fun pak a few months ago, Joshua was able to get me the colors I was dying to try so now when I have the right hot-end for my printer, I'll be making a big ULTRA PLA purchase. The colors are fantastic. These paks are a great way to check out new filaments without regret.

name: JSpinner 3D fun
title: First 3D print using PLA PAK - AWESOME!
review: After building our 1st Prusa i3v printer from a kit, we chose to use PLA filament because it does not have an obnoxious toxic smell when printing indoors, like ABS. Since we had no idea of what to expect from our new printer, we loaded the PLA to try out. We printed a blue transparent cube for the first test run, and it was AWESOME! There was no smell. It printed PERFECTLY and easily. No clogging, no imperfections in the PLA, and the entire experience was amazing. We had researched issues others had experienced with materials that were not of quality supplies. With our PLA PAX from MakerGeeks, we will not use anything of less quality. We highly recommend getting quality supplies you can depend on, from MakerGeeks.com.

name: Printed_Concepts
title: Good Sampler
review: Good for sampling of maker geeks PLA filament and how it works.  Also good for testing some colors and making a few small parts

name: Super Stonegiant
title: Love this stuff.
review:
-240deg on duplicator4 217deg on Solidoodle2.
-Solidoodle2 has a limit of 220. Running this material on Solidoodle is not good on it, but can be
done.
-Spools unravel to easy. Almost spring loaded.
-Even with the cons I still give this a 5, because it is truely beautiful material.

name: Gatekeeper Calvin
title: Fantastic filament!
review:
Bought this to make Christmas gifts for my friends and family. I'd had some... forgettable experiences with filament from Makergeeks in the past (though some quite memorably good ones as well!), and decided to give the new "Maker filament" a chance. Figured with the price, I didn't have much to loose. I can confidently say, I didn't loose a single thing!

Don't question the quality of the filament from the price, it's as good as any $50 roll I've ever used! It prints like a dream, it flows through the hot end like oiled butter, and sticks to the bed without hassle. The parts I've made with it are structurally sound, both with the novelty items I've made (tons and tons of pikachu figures) and the structural components I've made (fan shroud for an overheating motor on my printer) have held strong and effective.

The only disappointment I had with this filament was that from the picture, the plastic looked opaque. In person, the filament I got was quite obviously transparent. On prints with several perimeters and even moderate infill, prints will not be transparent, but on single-walled vases light will escape through.

Save for the lack of opacity, I can confidently say that this is some of the best-valued filament available for purchase! Would and WILL buy again!
